intro: Mariscus brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian marshmallow plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fleshy leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in wet, swampy environments and is often found in marshes and along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
